question.body: Anne Smith is a 38 year old Caucasian female who was recently diagnosed with leukemia (cancer of the blood cells). She had undergone 2 rounds of chemotherapy and has to have blood work done to check her levels of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets. Her last results showed a decrease in her red cells and platelets. Why might this have happened?

multiple_choice.choice: Because the leukemia has destroyed the bone marrow so that it cannot undergo hemopoiesis.
Because the chemotherapy is destroying the cancer and bone marrow so that it cannot undergo hemopoiesis.
Because she is 36 years old and the production of red cells and platelets decreases with age.
Because she has lost calcium salts from her bone and this has made her bones weaker.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The bone marrow is damaged and unable to produce the cells, but it is not from the leukemia.
Correct. The chemotherapy is also damaging healthy cells and consequently interfering with the production of red blood cells and platelets.
Incorrect. Age doesn’t decrease bone marrow function.
Incorrect. Her bones might be weaker, but not from lost calcium salts; they aren’t producing blood cells.
